jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)(of a couple) be involved in an established romantic or sexual relationship

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as an adverb): from Latin, in like manner, also'. The noun sense arose (late 16th cent.) from the use of the adverb to introduce each statement in a list

entry.def: An item is one of a collection or list of objects.

example.ex: The most valuable item on show will be a Picasso drawing...
example.tran: 展览会上最贵重的展品是毕加索的一幅素描。

example.ex: The menu includes the occasional off-beat item.
example.tran: 菜单中包括了偶尔会有的非传统菜肴。

entry.def: An item is one of a list of things for someone to do, deal with, or talk about.

example.ex: The other item on the agenda is the tour.
example.tran: 日程中的另一项是旅游。

entry.tran: 一篇报道(或文章);(新闻等的)一条,一则
entry.def: An item is a report or article in a newspaper or magazine, or on television or radio.

example.ex: There was an item in the paper about him.
example.tran: 报纸上有一条关于他的报道。

entry.def: If you say that two people are an item, you mean that they are having a romantic or sexual relationship.

example.ex: She and Gino were an item.

means.word_mean: 1. a distinct part that can be specified separately in a group of things that could be enumerated on a list;

sentences.sentence: "he noticed an item in the New York Times"
"she had several items on her shopping list"
"the main point on the agenda was taken up first"

means.word_mean: 2. a whole individual unit; especially when included in a list or collection;

sentences.sentence: "they reduced the price on many items"

means.word_mean: 3. a small part that can be considered separately from the whole;
4. an isolated fact that is considered separately from the whole;
5. an individual instance of a type of symbol;
1. (used when listing or enumerating items) also;

sentences.sentence: "a length of chain, item a hook"-Philip Guedalla

Sentence.sentence: To make shoppers see as many items as possible.
The model works for items that are expensive to buy and are widely owned by people who do not make full use of them
Sharing items such as cars does good to the environment
Shoppers refrained from buying cars, appliances, and other big-ticket items.
People refrained from buying durables and big-ticket items

Still, at the most selective schools, where thousands of candidates may submit identically high grades and test scores, a marginal item like the essay may serve as a tie-breaker between two equally qualified candidates.

means.word_mean: 一项, 一件, 一条; 项目

sentences.en: The police examined several items of clothing.
This is the next item on the agenda.
sentences.cn: 这是议事日程上的下一个项目。

sentences.en: Are there any interesting news items in the paper this morning?
sentences.cn: 今天早晨报上有什么有趣的新闻吗?

sentences.en: The shop window was filled with hundreds of items.
sentences.cn: 这家商店的橱窗里摆满了几百种物品。
